description: A port down event that has occurred due to SLPP. The user is
notified of the expected Vlan ID along with the Vlan ID and source
MAC address of the packet coming in on the port identified. The
first two objects can be used to lookup instance info for port id
and vlan id.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD RC-SLPP-MIB::rcnSlppPortDownEvent RAPID-CITY::rcSlppPortSlppEnable i 1 RAPID-CITY::rcSlppVlanSlppEnable i 1 RAPID-CITY::rcSlppIncomingVlanId i 1 RAPID-CITY::rcSlppSrcMacAddress s EXAMPL

description: Flag to indicate whether the port entry is active or not for SLPP.
variables.name: RAPID-CITY::rcSlppPortSlppEnable

description: Flag to indicate whether the VLAN entry is active or not for SLPP.
variables.name: RAPID-CITY::rcSlppVlanSlppEnable

description: Vlan id of the classified packet on the port brought down by SLPP.
variables.name: RAPID-CITY::rcSlppIncomingVlanId

description: Source MAC address in the classified packet on the port
brought down by SLPP.
variables.name: RAPID-CITY::rcSlppSrcMacAddress

description: A port down event that has occurred due to SLPP. The trap
includes the port and its Vlan which receives the packet, and
along with the Vlan ID and source MAC address of the packet coming in
on the port identified.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD RC-SLPP-MIB::rcnSlppPortDownEventNew RAPID-CITY::rcSlppRxPortIndex i 9999 RAPID-CITY::rcSlppRxVlanId i 1 RAPID-CITY::rcSlppIncomingVlanId i 1 RAPID-CITY::rcSlppSrcMacAddress s EXAMPL

description: Port on which the SLPP packet is received.
variables.name: RAPID-CITY::rcSlppRxPortIndex

description: Vlan on which the SLPP packet is received.
variables.name: RAPID-CITY::rcSlppRxVlanId

description: Vlan id of the classified packet on the port brought down by SLPP.
variables.name: RAPID-CITY::rcSlppIncomingVlanId

description: Source MAC address in the classified packet on the port
brought down by SLPP.
variables.name: RAPID-CITY::rcSlppSrcMacAddress

description: Indicates SLPP received its own packet but with the TX VLAN not
equal to the RX VLAN.

event.Summary: SLPP packet VLAN mismatched. TX VLAN : $v3 ; RX VLAN : $v2

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD RC-SLPP-MIB::rcnSlppLoopOnDiffVlan RAPID-CITY::rcSlppRxPortIndex i 9999 RAPID-CITY::rcSlppRxVlanId i 1 RC-SLPP-MIB::rcSlppTxVlanId i 1 RAPID-CITY::rcSlppSrcMacAddress s EXAMPL

description: Port on which the SLPP packet is received.
variables.name: RAPID-CITY::rcSlppRxPortIndex

description: Vlan on which the SLPP packet is received.
variables.name: RAPID-CITY::rcSlppRxVlanId

description: Vlan on which the SLPP packet is sent.
variables.name: RC-SLPP-MIB::rcSlppTxVlanId

description: Source MAC address in the classified packet on the port
brought down by SLPP.
variables.name: RAPID-CITY::rcSlppSrcMacAddress

description: Indicates that the SLPP-guard hold-down timer has expired on a port
on which SLPP-guard is enabled, and the port has been re-enabled.
Port on which the SLPP-guard packet is received.
variables.name: RC-SLPP-MIB::rcSlppGuardPortIfIndex

description: Indicates an SLPP packet has been received on a port on which
SLPP-guard is enabled. The port has been disabled.
Port on which the SLPP-guard packet is received.
variables.name: RC-SLPP-MIB::rcSlppGuardPortIfIndex
